name: Avoid using hard-coded HMAC keys (PHP)
description: This rule reports the use of an hard-coded key to encrypt or decrypt data.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Attacker can easily compromise the system if the HMAC keys are hard-coded.
reference:
CWE-321: Use of Hard-coded Cryptographic Key
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/321.html

OWASP Top Ten 2021 Category A02:2021 - Cryptographic Failures
https://owasp.org/Top10/A02_2021-Cryptographic_Failures/

HMAX definition by WikipediA
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC
remediation:
Generate the keys.

Alternatively, use a key stored in a file with a dedicated format such as PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail).
